alert.note: Alert for Estill; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 12:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Powell, southern Montgomery, north central Estill and southwestern Menifee Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1232 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Levee, or near Mount Sterling, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lower Spencer and Oggs Station around 1240 PM EDT. Jeffersonville and Virden around 1245 PM EDT. Clay City, Bean, Waltersville and Powell Valley around 1250 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lucky Stop, Clay Lick, Stanton, Cat Creek, Rosslyn, Bowen, Means, Cedar Groves, Vaughns Mill, Lombard, Knowlton and Fagan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
